title: MCP: Restore policy controller parity
summary: Port the legacy autopilot policy controller into UnifiedOrchestrator so policy state and escalations are recorded for every guardrail breach.
notes: Bring back autopilot.sh's policy controller hook (tools/wvo_mcp/scripts/autopilot_policy.py) so the TS orchestrator writes state/policy/autopilot_policy.json updates, appends to state/analytics/autopilot_policy_history.jsonl, and logs escalations in state/escalations.log whenever TaskVerifier or queue starvation triggers. Ensure Director Dana regains the rolling policy view before the next orchestration release.
signals: Legacy bash autopilot provided visibility into guardrail bumps; the new orchestrator currently drops those events.
integration: Wire the policy controller into TaskVerifier and analytics so supervisors see escalations alongside queue health.

title: MCP: Reinstate critic fatigue backoff
summary: Load the critic backoff state in UnifiedOrchestrator to throttle critiquers that repeatedly fail instead of hammering them every cycle.
notes: Teach AgentHierarchy to read/write state/autopilot_critics_backoff.json, reuse CRITICS_BACKOFF_WINDOW semantics, and log restarts so critics that keep erroring get a cooldown before retry. Preserve the legacy fatigue protection autopilot.sh enforced.
signals: Critics currently rerun every minute when they fail; the bash autopilot avoided this churn with a backoff map.
integration: Integrate cooldown decisions into the scheduler so critic assignments respect fatigue state without bypassing verification.

title: MCP: Add usage-limit cooldowns
summary: Teach UnifiedOrchestrator to respect Codex/Claude rate ceilings with the same cooldown the bash autopilot used.
notes: Detect quota-exhaustion responses from Codex and Claude, sleep for USAGE_LIMIT_BACKOFF seconds (configurable), and emit telemetry so planners see why the queue paused. This restores autopilot.sh's guard against thrashing the CLI when usage caps hit.
signals: Current orchestrator hammers Codex until it fails hard; legacy flows slept and logged the wait.
integration: Hook cooldown decisions into the executor/TaskVerifier combination so rate limit sleeps propagate to metrics and downstream agents.

title: MCP: Restore task memos trail
summary: Persist short memos after every agent task under state/task_memos and surface the latest entry in downstream prompts.
notes: After executeTask completes (including blocked or deferred runs), emit a concise Markdown memo capturing decisions and next steps, mirroring autopilot.sh. Link the memo path into context assembly so successors inherit breadcrumbs when resuming work.
signals: Operators lost the running diary that made the shell loop resumable.
integration: Extend context assembler to reference memo files while keeping cache size under control.

title: MCP: Enforce clean worktree gate
summary: Block UnifiedOrchestrator startup when the git worktree is dirty unless an explicit override is provided.
notes: Reuse the guardrail from tools/wvo_mcp/scripts/autopilot.sh or scripts/restart_mcp.sh to abort startup (or require --allow-dirty) whenever tracked files have uncommitted changes. Surface the warning in logs so operators avoid stacking edits on unknown diffs.
signals: Legacy autop refused to run on dirty trees; the new orchestrator will happily mutate messy repos.
integration: Tie the guard into orchestration bootstrap so build agents respect repo hygiene.

title: MCP: Dual high-end architecture planners
summary: Spin up a Sonnet 4.5 planning lane with a Codex 5-high review lane so UnifiedOrchestrator can co-design the website architecture with long-horizon reasoning.
notes: Configure the orchestrator to allocate a dedicated Sonnet 4.5 planner (long-form architecture exploration) that runs concurrently with a Codex 5-high reviewer, exchanging drafts through critics to keep the plan optimal. Ensure their artifacts (design memos, decision logs) feed into context assembly so downstream builders inherit the architecture narrative.
signals: Leadership wants high-end models to own architecture design rather than ad-hoc prompts.
integration: Teach the scheduler to coordinate parallel planning/review tasks and publish outputs into the shared architecture docket for engineering teams.

title: MCP: Surface historical build context
summary: Expand the context assembler so architecture planners see prior experiments, docs, and early code attempts before proposing new directions.
notes: Index earlier demo builds, legacy orchestrator docs, and relevant repo history into a navigable cache (e.g., docs/UNIFIED_AUTOPILOT_IMPLEMENTATION.md, prior web spikes) and thread references into prompts for Sonnet/Codex planning sessions. Add critics to validate that new plans acknowledge or intentionally diverge from past work.
signals: We are losing touch with earlier coding attempts and need historical awareness in planning.
integration: Extend cache-backed context assembler with a historical registry that agents can query without bloating every prompt.
